BIRMINGHAM
Dear Marion:
I have at hand your letter of August 12
which inquires as to the progress being made
in my suggesting individuals for the NAEB
Speaker’s Guide as per your inquiry on July 28,
Your July 28 letter came while I was on
vacation, and I have been meaning to write you
since that date.
STAFF
RAYMOND D. HURLBERT
GENERAL MANAGER
AL RENFRO
CHIEF ENGINEER
LOUIS PENEGUY
DIRECTOR
COORDINATION & INFORMATION
MRS. MADGE LAW
OFFICE MANAGER
Due to administrative reasons, the Alabama
Educational Television Commission discontinued
its membership with NAEB, It has transferred
its trade association relationship to the
National Association for Educational Television.
At the time of this transfer (the end of June of
this year) it seemed logical that I suspend my
NAEB affiliation rather than spread myself
thin with too many trade associations at a
time when I will be programming the new Mobile
station independently of my work with the
Alabama Educational Television network. As a
result of this, I presume it would be best for
me to withdraw from the NAEB PR Council rather
than attempt to serve in both associations. I
regret that I do this because I have met some
interesting people in NAEB, and it was only
last year that NAEB finally "recognized” we
PR workers by permitting us to be on the NAEB
national convention programs.
Further, with the AETC transfer from its
affiliation with NAEB to its association with
NAET, we of the AETC staff will no longer be
sent to NAEB regional or national meetings.
This would mean that I would be unable to
consult with the NAEB PR members, which (again)
would make ray work on the PR Committee limited.
The nation’s first educational television network telecasts programs simultaneously over four channels, which are originated by Auburn
University, the Birmingham Area Educational Television Association, and the University of Alabama. National Educational Television
(NET) programs are provided to the network by the University of Alabama. Independently operated WEIQ-TV is also a NET affiliate.
